name: Grilled Chicken Thighs Cacciatore with Super Smashed Garlic Potatoes
headline: Grilled Chicken Thighs Cacciatore with Super Smashed Garlic Potatoes
keywords: Easy Chicken,Chicken Recipes,Poultry,Easy Main Dish,Main Dish,Easy Grilling Recipes and Tips,Grilling,Grilled Chicken,Grilled Vegetable,Italian,Cacciatore,Chicken Thigh,High Fiber
recipeIngredient: 4 large starchy potatoes, such as Idaho
1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, 1/3 palm full
3 tablespoons fresh rosemary, 4 to 5 sprigs, stripped and leaves chopped
4 large portobello mushroom caps, wiped clean with damp towel
1 1/2 pounds, 6 pieces or 1 package, boneless, skinless chicken thighs
2 cubanelle (Italian light green peppers), seeded and thinly sliced
1 (28-ounce) can or 2 (14-ounce) cans fire roasted diced tomatoes, lightly drained (recommended: Muir Glenn brand)
1 cup shredded or grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Romano, 3 generous handfuls

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill to high heat.

Peel up the taters and cut them into small chunks. Place potatoes in a pot and cover with cold water. Cover the pot and bring up to a boil over high heat. Uncover, add salt to season up the potatoes and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.

In a small pot over medium low heat and add vegetable oil, about 1 tablespoon â€“ just eyeball it. Add 2 tablespoons butter in small pieces. When butter melts into oil, add 4 cloves of chopped garlic. Saute garlic 1 to 2 minutes, then add scallions and remove pan from heat and reserve.
Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.

In a large bowl, combine balsamic vinegar, Worcestershire, crushed red pepper flakes, rosemary then whisk in about 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil, eyeball it. Turn portobello caps in marinade and transfer to a plate to reserve. Add chicken thighs to remaining marinade and coat evenly. Season 1 side of the chicken thighs, as well as the reserved mushroom caps with salt and pepper then transfer just the thighs to hot grill, seasoned side down. Season the opposite side of the chicken thighs and grill for 6 minutes on each side then transfer to a plate to rest. Add raw marinated mushroom caps to grill and top with a heavy skillet to press down on them as they grill. Cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side until, dark, tender and well-marked.

While chicken thighs and mushrooms cook, add a tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, a turn of the pan, to hot skillet. Add remaining 2 cloves of garlic, peppers and onions to the skillet season with salt and pepper and cook, tossing frequently, 7 to 8 minutes. Add tomatoes and parsley to the pan and toss to heat through, about 1 minute then remove from heat.
Thinly slice rested chicken thigh meat and grilled mushrooms.

Drain potatoes then return them to the hot pot to evaporate some of the water content. Add the reserved garlic and scallion mixture to the potatoes along with the ricotta, 1/2 cup milk and grated cheese and smash away to combine potatoes with cheeses and milk. Season the super-mashers with salt and pepper.
Pile up 1/4 of the potatoes on each plate. Top each pile with 1/4 of chicken, mushrooms and sauce and serve immediately. Yum-o!

review.reviewBody: Yummy!  I make over pasta instead of potatoes. Marinating ahead of time made the chicken much spicier.  I printed this recipe in 2005 and am still making
This was very good. I thought that the chicken and mushrooms needed to marinade for a much longer time. On its own it was kinda bland. The potatoes were very good.

I have to admit that it was a bit more work than the time allotted. however, if you read the recipe you gotta realize that this recipe is going to take some coordination.

I used only one pepper, grilled the chicken, and with all the oil, it was hard to keep the flames down. Potatoes were great and the meal overall was very good, just a bit more work than tacos. But the family loved it and clean up was no bust. Will make again, but for when we have guest.

It was a LOT of work - not 30 minutes.
After all those steps, we were a little let down by the taste.
We like Rachel Ray, but we'll probably just skip this recipe in the future.

This is a great recipe. Instead of using whole mushroom caps, I used sliced mushrooms and put all of the veggies minus the tomatoes in the marinade while the chicken was cooking. When the chicken was done, I removed from the pan and cooked the veggies in the same pan. After a few minutes of cooking, I added the tomatoes and garlic. I simmered the veggies for about 25 minutes and added the chicken back to the skillet to warm up.
The taste was good. I let the chicken sit in the sauce a while. I also used a red and yellow pepper instead of what's in the recipe. I give 4 stars because there were so many dishes to clean after!
Lots of stuff going on but great flavors and great dish.  Marinating chicken all day upped the flavor quotient as well.
I love chicken thighs. They are my favorite part of the chicken. I was scrolling through the website and this caught my attention. Printed it, cooked it, loved it.

Overall this was a great recipe.  I made a few changes that made the dish taste fresher.  I opted to forgo the fire-roasted diced tomatoes and just used regular diced tomatoes.  I omitted the portobello mushrooms and went for anaheim peppers instead of the cubanelle.  I actually had the chicken thighs marinating for a bit before I grilled them instead of just adding the marinade to the chicken thighs right before grilling.  The smashed potatoes were a big hit and I absolutely loved how the garlic flavor resonated through the potatoes.  Definitely a keeper and a very easy recipe to cook up quickly!
I just made the chicken and I loved the marinade. I have a rosemary plant and that fresh rosemary flavor was really nice. Some of the other posters might be using dried herbs, hence the bland sauce.

This was a delicious, quick meal.  I used store bought mashed potatoes to make things even quicker.  My store did not have cubanelles so I just used red and yellow bell peppers and a white onion.  The hubby practically licked the bowl clean he enjoyed it that much :)  Definitely a keeper!
Wonderful! I made this dish with boneless,skinless,chicken breast. It was awesome. My family enjoyed this  recipe. I have been told to make it again.

My family LOVED this recipe, but only after I did a little tweaking to it. I agree with other reviewers that the sauce was very bland so I added in the ingrediants of the marinade to the sauce and it turned out so full of flavor! As for the potatoes, they were horrible. The ricotta just makes the potatoes grainy and lack-luster. I will definately make the chicken again, but with just good old garlic mashers instead. Thanks Rachel for the recipe!

For those of you who are saying this isn't a 30-min meal, here's my suggestions for shortcuts -- use a prepared marinara or tomato sauce. I used Giada's veg marinara (avail at target) and it had all the components of the sauce and all I had to do was warm and pour it over the chicken. For the chicken, I have a cuisinart griddler, so i can grill foods on both sides at the same time. I also used left over rice I had in the refrigerator instead of the pasta.

It might not be a true 30-min meal, but whatever choice of prep you use, it's still a good recipe! looking forward to making it again.

What this recipe is not is a 30 minute meal. I consider myself an accomplished cook and there is NO way I would have been able to complete the entire dish in 30 minutes. That said....who cares....it was totally worth it.
I made the recipe nearly as published with only minor alterations. I added about 1/3 cup red wine to the pepper/onion/garlic saute to deglaze the pan and let it mostly cook off. Then added the tomatoes and parsley as well as a bit of basil since I had it in the garden. My chicken thighs were not boneless and next time I will make sure they are.
Didn't have any ricotta cheese in the fridge, but I did have mozzarella....no problem...was very nicely gooey with the potatoes and added garlic/butter mixture.
This one has been saved. Wonderful flavor....will be making again, and again, and again. Good company meal.
(Oh, and I did have some mesquite chips on the grill for a little smoke....Yum)
This was recipe came out so good, thumbs up Rachel Ray [:

Extremely flavorful ... yet it took me so long to complete the dish. I would never recommend this as a 30-minute meal.  Since I used the outside grill, I needed to complete the potatoes & tomato portion first.   This would make an outstanding veggie dish by removing the chicken & adding two additional shroom caps.

My daughter made this for dinner; the chicken was very good (minus the cubanelle peppers and fire-roasted tomatoes). The potatoes were very good, too, but I wonder why you would just add the milk without heating it through (even room temperature milk will make the potatoes get cool). I would think one would want potatoes that were at the very least warm. She didn't make the mushrooms and we really didn't miss them with the meal. The next time this dish gets made I'll try it with chicken cutlets. REMEMBER TO HEAT THE MILK IF YOU WANT WARM POTATOES TO GO WITH THE REST OF THE MEAL!!!!!
THIS RECIPE IS SO GOOD!!! DON'T BE SCARED, HAVE A LOT OF INGREDIENTS BUT IS SUPER EASY TO DO!! THUMPS UP RACHAEL!!

I am doing Weight Watchers so I reduced the oil and butter to 4 tsp oil for the chicken and mushrooms, and 2 tsp butter for the potatoes, and it was so rich and flavorful I was in heaven! Do not have a grill so I cooked the chicken thighs in my small cast iron pan in stages. Then cooked the mushrooms - used Creminis sliced thick - in the pan, and then the onions, to get some nice flavor on each. All this stretched the prep time way past 30 minutes, but well worth it. I assembled the whole thing with the tomatoes and peppers. I used bottled roasted red peppers for convenience. I did spring for fresh rosemary and it made a big difference.

Really, this was one of the best things I have ever cooked.

I followed the recipe exactly no substitutions or changes and in my opinion this recipe needs some serious changes.  The chicken turned out very good and the marinade for the  mushrooms was really good but I would double the recipe because instead of getting big mushroom caps I would just get small mushrooms and saute them in the marinade.  The cacciatore was rather lack luster it definitely needed red, yellow and red bell peppers cut up in as well as a bit of extra seasoning.  The garlic mashed potatoes were a complete disaster! First off i would totally ditch the ricotta cheese and add like a stick and a half of butter plus some salt and pepper and lord only knows if that would help enough.
I saw this when it aired way awhile back...made it while it was fresh in my mind and loved it. I need to see the video again to organize the choreography in MY kitchen.....help?

I loved this recipe.  I don't know why other reviewers think there are so many steps.  Nothing more than an average night dinner.  Extremely simple.  I didn't do the mashed potatoes, although they sound delicious.  It was an excellent meal as I ladled the tomato sauce, then the chicken and mushroom.  Had a simple salad on the side and that was plenty.  Added some grated parmesan on top.  Seems like a very easy recipe to substitute such as dried rosemary for fresh.  Loved it.  And the thighs are soooo much more tasty and moist than breasts.

This is just OK and here's why: There are a lot of steps for a weeknight.   I followed the recipe down to the Muir Glen.  My whole family tried it Mom, Dad and 20+ sons home from college.  All said  nothing special but not bad.  On a positive note, the marinade grilled chicken and mushrooms  stand well alone as well as the potatoes if you'd like to use for another recipe.  Yes, easy...a lot of easy steps.

I have made this several times and have changed it up a few times as well.  Most of the time I use chicken breasts rather than thighs (not a fan of dark meat).  I don't always make it with the smashed potatoes either.  This is a really good recipe and it's something we love!!

I'm lazy in the kitchen and can't always find the fresh herbs & spices I need, so used Gourmet Garden's (gourmetgarden.com) squeeze tube garlic, chili pepper and parlsey from my local Safeway's produce department. No fuss, no mess or waste. This was wonderful!

I have never taken the time to return to a website and leave a review on anything before in my life.  This meal did take me longer than 30 minutes, but it was WELL worth it!  This meal was so delicious it is now a must have staple.  The chicken thighs are so moist, juicy, and full of flavor.  The potatoes were full of cheesy goodness.  I was worried the tomato sauce would take away from the other flavors, but if you take a little bite with the potatoes, you get new falvorful bites.  I plan on making this once a week.  Excellent job, Rachael!
Our Grandson cooked this excellent meal for us. It was very tasty, to say the least, and looking forward to the SuperSmash potatoes again at the holidayt period.

This recipe is fabulous and you don't have to grill anything.  I just cooked it up in a non-stick skillet.  First the chicken, then the mushrooms, removed to plate and covered and then added vegetables to pan to cook.  Clean up was simple.

Easy to fix, tasty, and everyone from the 4 year old to the 44 year old LOVED it!  That get's five stars.  Hubby can grill the chicken and mushrooms while mom and helpers prep the rest.  Really, really, savory and hearty!  Served with a spinach salad and warm, spoon cake for dessert.  Perfect!

The chicken thighs make this recipe moist and flavorful.  It took me nearly an hour to make, but I could probably get this down as I make it more often.  My only complaint was that the smashed potatoes could have used more salt but my husband went back for thirds.  A wonderful recipe that is easy enough to make during a busy week!

When I saw Rachel make this, I knew it was going to be good; however, not in 30 minutes.  I added some celery and carrots with the peppers/onions for a more deep flavor.  Also, once the fire-roasted tomatoes went in, I added a splash of Marsala wine and simmered the sauce for 45 minutes until it reduced a bit.  Those small additions made this dish over the top!
i dont kno about the meat or mushrooms...... because i only made the potatoes because im a vegetarion... I LOVED THEM!
This was good. I mean, come on ppl...for the amount of $$$ you spend on this (cheap!), the amount of time (it IS less than 30 minutes!) it is a great meal.

i think it's great ,but a lot more work.
then i wanted to do..

This chicken was good, I marinated the chicken and grilled it on my george foreman and the grilled the portablella mushrooms on the george foreman and they were wonderful.  I did not have ricotta cheese for the potatoes so I used a little neufetcial some cottage cheese and sour cream.  potatoes were great as well.  The fire roasted tomatoes and onions added a nice touch.  I would make this recipe again.
Delicious and rich- super easy and quick!  I made this for a friend visiting from out of town- she loved it so much and was so impressed that she insists I make it everytime she visits now.....

I make this recipe all the time with a few changes.  I use boneless breasts of chicken instead of thighs only because I always have them in the freezer. I use baby bellas, marinated and cooked with the tomatoes.  And I use poblanos because they are easier for me to find.  My family loves this recipe!

We've made this meal twice now and made extra to freeze for later.  It fits the whole family.  It is healthy, hearty, and a little bit different.  Takes a ton of dishes and knives, but worth the extra work!
the smashed potatoes were amazing so chessey and creamy

I only made the mashed potatoes in this recipe but they were delicious! Instead of using Idaho potatoes I used 2 pounds of redskins for 4 people, like Rachael Ray did on the show.  Between 4 girls we managed to eat the whole batch!
This was a great dish. My husband loved it!

I used unpeeled red potatoes and grated Parmesan cheese with the ricotta to make the smashed. Doubled up on the marinade letting the mushrooms soak it up a bit longer made for an interesting balsamic taste when cooked.  The girlfriend was impressed and even took the leftovers today for her and her friends lunch!

I prepared this yesterday noting the time carefully.  It took me 55 minutes just to prep the food.  (I  always clean my chicken because Julia Child said that if we saw how chicken was processed, no one would ever eat it!)  It took me another 40 minutes to cook it all.  I do not even want to go into what my kitchen looked like!!!  My All Clad grill pan needed to soak overnight.  The flavor was good but certainly NOT worth all the time and effort!  I will never make this again.

I made this last night for dinner and my husband couldn't get enough. The potatoes were wonderful with this dish.  The only thing I did differently was not add the cubanelle peppers as I couldn't find them.   My hubby has asked me to put this recipe in my regular rotation as it was very easy to put together and inexpensive as I had almost everything in stock.  I made marinade and put chicken and mushrooms in fridge for a couple of hours and the flavors really melded together.  Great job Rachel!

Just like Rachel says, "This is DE-LISH!!" my whole family loves it. My teenager says it's the best chicken he has ever tasted. I have to agree. It's pretty darn good & SOOOO easy to make. We make chicken breast sandwiches with the same marinade. LOVE IT!!

I loved this dish--I served it for a relative who was visiting from out of town and she was very impressed with the presentation and the flavor. Trust me, this relative is the type to tell you when she's NOT impressed, so I know she was telling the truth! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I didn't think the ricotta added anything to the dish, except calories and fat. You can make the potatoes just as tasty and rich without the ricotta. (My secret is to use evaporated fat-free milk...all the creaminess, none of the fat). Plus, I never really have a need for the leftover ricotta after I use the 1 cup for the recipe, so it goes to waste. I made it a second time minus the ricotta and it was just as good. Kudos, Rachael, on the recipe--it's awesome for entertaining!

My husband is a picky eater and he typically likes just plain meat and potatoes. When I served this, he said, "Wow, Hon. This is good. You can make this again." I have and it was a hit. My daughter really liked the garlic smashed potatoes. I also used the marinade to make chicken on the grill...Yummy!
Quick, easy, absolutely delicious!  My family raved about this dish and begged for more.

and actually not that hard to make.
You can' s do anything wrong!
I had used skinless boneless chicken breasts. I sliced, marrinated, and then sauteed them. The dish came out wonderfully.
We all thought it was very tasty, including my kids.
Excellent taste and easy to make.  The vegetable off set the spicy taste of the chicken and mushrooms.
This recipes was good but it wasn't anything wonderful. Will make again
Loved the potatoes. did not make the chicken.
This recipe was super easy, because I saw it prepared on your program.  My husband really loved it, I have recommeded it to others.
This recipe was both easy and delicious, I made it for the first time for company and everyone was delighted and so was I!  Love you Rachael!

First, let me say that this turned out great although I think the tomato/peppers/onion topping was a little overpowering to the chicken/mushrooms but overall, a definite do-again meal (with a few modifications).  However, if you did not see the program and only have the recipe as provided, you might want to know she used baby red taters not Idahos, and she grilled the mushrooms first (i.e. before the chicken so as to not have a cross contamination issue with the raw chicken).  She also specifically said NOT to salt the mushrooms until they had been grilled (so as to avoid drawing out too much moisture, and to enhance the carmalization process).  I don't think anything would be lost by using creminis instead of portobellos (I was not impressed with how they grilled up).  I just used regular mashed taters but did add the butter/garlic/scallion mix which was fabulous.  You can also make this up ahead of time, layer the chicken (I left mine whole), sliced mushrooms and pepper/onion/tomato sauce in casserole, then heat at 350 for about 30 minutes; serve on top of mashed taters as in recipe -- yummy!!
This was fairly simple and the marinade took to the chicken surprisingly quickly.  My husband and kids really liked it.
easy preparation, you have to like the grilled flavor. It is a healthy alternative recipe for chicken cacciatore
This was excellent and very easy.  My entire family loved this one!

When you know you have chicken thighs in your freezer but you're not quite sure how to cook them, USE THIS RECIPE. You'll also finally know how to cook those large portobello mushroom caps that you always see at the supermarket. Everything comes out delicious if you follow the recipe.

I've made several Rachael Ray's recipes before, but this Cacciatore is out of this world!!!
It was a little on the spicy side, but I blame myself for that. I couldn't find cubanelles, but I had some Hot hungarian peppers growing in my garden that I subsituded instead. Maybe too many, but I'm not complaining! My husband and me both like spicy.
Can't wait to make it again!
Oh yeh, I made the smashed potato as well as the Cacciatore dish, and they were both awesome!
Make sure everything is cutted and cleaned before you start because it goes way fast but everyone loved it

Easy, quick and flavorful.
I love this for summer cooking no messy kitchen to clean up and it is the best tasting chicken I have ever had.

Easy and tasty.  I ended up mixing it with pasta, and it was really good.  I liked using the thighs (instead of our usual chicken breasts).  We would opt not to put the portabello in next time (didn't seem to reheat as well as the other stuff).

Being "new" to cooking, I found this recipe called for good prep and organization.  Things got a little hectic for me keeping track of pots on the stove / ingredients / cooking times etc.  Everything came out well, however, and I like the emphasis in Rachael's recipes on spice - vegetables - flavor!

THIS  RECIPE IS GREAT.   I WATCHED THE SHOW AND SHE CLEARLY USED AND STATED TO USE THE  SMALL RED OR SMALL GOLDEN.....KEY WORD BEING SMALL.  OR NEW POTATOES ..... LARGE POTATOES, I THINK, WOULD RUIN THIS RECIPE.
Recipe looks ok

This meal was delish. Definitely not 30 minutes, lots and lots of chopping and slicing. Had no problem finding the ingredients in Monticello, NY. Smashed potatoes were wonderful by themselves.

Used Perdue skinned/boneless thighs, no fat to trim, worth the money.

Will use this marinade in the future for other chicken parts as well.
Kudos to you Rachel
Come to our house and cook!!!!!!

This recipe is easy to make. Since I am a beginner cook this took me about 1 hr. to make. The marinade for the chicken and mushrooms is delicious. The next time a may go a little easier on the rosemary. I used regular green peppers, because I could not find the other peppers it called for. It probably would have given the dish more of a kick vs. regular old green peppers. The scallion/garlic mixture for the potatoes was wonderful. I did not use the Ricotta.
I love chicken and I love mushrooms, so this recipe is right up my alley! My mouth literally waters everytime I think about this scrumptous recipe!
I have yet to try this receipe but it looked so simple and easy to make on the tv that I really wanted the receipe to try it.  I just love your show,and you make meals that ordinary ppl might enjoy.
your smashed garlic potatoes was out of this world my whole family loved them.

This recipe turned out fairly well.  The smashed potatoes would be great by themselves as a side dish.  Although they are very high in fat content with the oil, butter, and cheeses.  Even though this is from "30 Minute Meals," be honest with yourself, you're not Rachel and you don't have a tv crew helping you out - it's going to take you at least an hour.  And, really, I feel the flavor of the chicken and the portobellas would really benefit from a longer amount of time in the marinade.  Speaking of the marinade, this recipe calls for 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes which is great if you like hot, but not everyone does so I scaled it back to half a teaspoon.  I also couldn't find the specific peppers that were called for so I used Anaheims which worked well.  I think plain green pepper would be fine, too, especially if you want to lessen the overall spicy heat of the dish.  Overall, I liked this recipe and will likely make it again.  It would be very easy to do for a dinner party if you added italian bread a small starter salad and a mild dessert with marscapone to calm the palet after the spicyness of the main course.

It seemed that this took too long to make and the sauce had no flavor. I added a zillion cloves of garlic and a bunch of other italian seasonings, and it was still dead.  I have, however, saved the marinade portion of this recipe and used it for plain chicken or portobello mushrooms. It's fabulous.  I also didn't care for the mashed potatoes... I like my own garlic mashed potatoes better without the cheese. I found the ricotta made it more grainy than smooth and creamy that my family enjoys.
The marinade for the chicken is outstanding and so simple. Wonderful meal!!

I love Chicken Cacciatore.  I always begged my mom to make it although, of course, her recipe was quite different.  I loved this one because chicken and portobello muschrooms are two of my favs.  Again I left out the taters, and just had the meat and veggies.  Now THAT is comfort food!

This was simply deeelish. I forgot to by the Portobello caps, but had baby bellas at home, so I just sauteed them to carmelize and added them into the sauce. Still so yummy. Made enough to feed an army, too. My husband and I give this two thumbs up and 5 stars!

Thanks Rachel for another great recipe.
This was as great a Chicken Caccatiore
Really easy and cheap using the thighs rather than the more expensive cuts.
This is a very good recipe. I did this twice with good result both times. Easy to follow instructions and very tasty.

What a great recipe. Our 14 year old - who likes absolutely nothing right now -had two helpings.  Took longer then 30 minutes to prepare but was worth every minute of it.  Skipped the Ricotta cheese since I don't like the texture.  This will definately become a regular at our table.  Thank you Rachel.

This recipe goes together in less than 30 minutes (though marinading time can be increased).  The portobellos are fantastic with the chicken.  I didn't care for the potato recipe much, but there are so many variation of smashed potatoes, that it can be adjusted to personal taste.  The peppers added a great accent.  My family loved it.

1st ever.WOW!I've never smiled so much during a meal til yesterday.New use of Lea&Perrin's 4 chicken so can't say if it heighten the flavor but the marinade was hot & fantastic, the fire-roasted tomatoes w/garlic,onion,cubanelle & parsley was awesome, the potatoes were great. The only change I'd make is to slice and cut the thighs and portobellos into bite-size pieces so that when I scoop the potatoes, my fork with pick up the thighs & mushrooms & tomatoes dripping with onions and peppers straight to my mouth instead of cutting into the thighs/portobellos on top of the mashed potatoes.I couldn't wait to finish to call my Mother and tell her about it, even took a picture of the plate.I'll prepare this at my sister's at Xmas. GoRachel! GoRachel!
very flavorful, great on the grill.
This is a regular item in my house now. The thighs are good even without the sauce (but not worth leaving it off!)
Very easy to make for weeknight dinner.  Instead of the canned tomatoes, I used Rotel's Bold Italian canned tomatoes.
This meal was great.  I hosted a dinner party last weekend and this dish was a hit!  I received calls the next day asking for the recipe.

For those of you who didn't like all of the fat on the chicken thighs (neither do I) and found the prep a lot of work, I've discovered boneless, skinless frozen in 4 pound bags at Stater Brothers market.  Other stores may have it as well.  They have very little fat compared to the fresh.  This is a real find for me, as I think the thighs have so much more flavor than breast meat.
This was delicious. We had company for dinner and it was a big hit!  Actually, it was wonderful.  We will definitely fix it again.  Thank you, Rachal.

I made this dish as part of a buffet for friends.  It was devoured completely and received rave reviews.  I made a slight change in the recipe.  I used 1 cubenelle pepper and 1 yellow bell pepper. I also combined boneless chicken thighs and boneless chicken breasts.  Everyone loved it!  And it fed quite a bit of people too.  Try this -- you'll love it.

The taste of this dish was wonderful.  Cooked the chicken and mushrooms and kept them warm in the oven while I prepared the rest.  All of the juice that collected on the plate and in the pan was incorporated into the tomato sauce. On the down side, I have been cooking for over half my life and I have never had one of these recipes come in any where close to 30 minutes. Give yourself time and enjoy.
hearty and flavorful- the marinade is so easy.
Everything is beautifully done up on the show and on our plates here at home. I am always impressed with Rachel and her 30 minute meals!! Please don't ever go off the air!!

It was a perfect taste ensemble.The grilled chicken and the portabellas was awesome, along with the Super slamming garlic potatoes.  My family can't wait for me to fix it again. I actually watched that episode and thought it had to be slamming(fantastic).

This recipe was really, really tasty. My husband, who has a hard time eating vegetables, even loved it. However,  I marinated the chicken overnight in the Worcestshire and balsamic vinegar and oil--what a flavor punch that was! I think to save on calories and fat next time, I'm going to use evaporated skim milk instead of ricotta and regular milk in the potatoes. Ricotta didn't add much flavor, and I wasn't thrilled with the consistency.  Also, it was too much garlic for me. I'm going to cut it down a tad next time. Overall, I can't wait to serve this the next time we have company for dinner!
My family loved the chicken and garlic potatoes. I give these potatoes a rating of 10.
Great flavor and very easy to make.
I just made the potatoes and we loved them.  They are just as good warmed up the next day.  Try them.

video.name: Chicken Thighs Cacciatore
video.description: The only way to improve chicken cacciatore: serve it over mashed potatoes!
